data.description: Eversource will not offer immigration-related sponsorship for this position.  Applicants who require immigration sponsorship—either now or in the future—should not apply.  This includes, but is not limited to, direct company sponsorship, listing Eversource as the employer of record on immigration documents, or any work authorization that requires company involvement or documentation (e.g., H-1B, OPT, STEM OPT, CPT, TN, J-1, O-1, etc.).Eversource Energy is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Summer Intern to assist in improving and documenting key business processes within our internal TIS Dashboard program, housed within SharePoint and a Microsoft Power App. This internship provides hands-on experience in business process analysis, system documentation, data reporting, and process improvement initiatives. The intern will gain exposure to real-world business operations, develop technical and analytical skills, and engage with cross-functional teams.Summer Intern – Business Systems Analyst (Monday.com / Workflow + CRM)Department: Strategic SolutionsLocation: Hybrid (Hartford, CT)Duration: Summer 2026 (10–12 weeks)Schedule: Full-time, 40 hours/week (not flexible) Position SummaryEversource is seeking a highly motivated, tech-savvy intern to support internal operations and process improvement efforts within our Strategic Solutions department. This role will directly support the department’s Business Systems Analyst (BSA) in maintaining and improving Monday.com as a core platform supporting the Eversource Transmission Interconnections process workflow and CRM (Customer Relationship Management).In addition to supporting workflow configuration and reporting within Monday.com, the intern will assist with document organization and system enablement using SharePoint as the official document repository. The intern will also leverage Microsoft Copilot to support documentation and improve team efficiency.This internship is ideal for a student who is excited about process improvement, business systems, workflow automation, and stakeholder engagement, and who wants hands-on experience supporting real business workflows in an enterprise environment. Key ResponsibilitiesMonday.com Workflow + CRM Support Support the Business Systems Analyst (BSA) in configuring and maintaining Monday.com as a workflow management and CRM platform supporting Transmission InterconnectionsBuild and enhance Monday.com components including boards, dashboards, forms, views, permissions, integrations, and automationsParticipate in discussions with internal stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into structured workflowsAssist with requirements gathering, including documenting business needs, process steps, and user requirementsSupport internal workflow improvements that enhance tracking, coordination, reporting, and visibility across the Transmission Interconnections processAssist with testing and quality assurance including user acceptance testing (UAT), troubleshooting, and validating system configuration changesSupport data accuracy, consistency, and reporting through ongoing system cleanup and continuous improvementSharePoint / Document Repository SupportAssist in maintaining and improving SharePoint sites and document libraries used as the official document repositoryOrganize document structures and ensure consistent file naming, versioning, and location standardsHelp ensure workflow records in Monday.com link to supporting documentation stored in SharePointDocumentation, Training, and Adoption SupportCreate and maintain job aids, quick-reference guides, and workflow documentationSupport internal training and adoption by helping develop training content and responding to user questionsGather user feedback and recommend usability improvements within Monday.com and SharePoint AI Productivity and Enablement (Microsoft Copilot)Utilize Microsoft Copilot to support documentation, summarization, and organization of workflow/process contentAssist with developing repeatable prompt templates and simple AI-enabled approaches that improve team efficiencyDemonstrate good judgment regarding validation of AI outputs and awareness of data sensitivity  Required QualificationsCurrent undergraduate or graduate student pursuing a degree in a related field such as: Management Information Systems (MIS), Information Systems, Business Analytics, Industrial Engineering, Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or similar Strong interest in workflow systems, business analysis, process improvement, and low-code/no-code toolsStrong communication skills with comfort engaging stakeholders at different levels of the organizationHighly organized, reliable, and detail-orientedStrong written communication skills (documentation, summarization, process notes)Preferred QualificationsExperience with Monday.com or similar tools (Airtable, Smartsheet, Asana, Jira, Salesforce, etc.)Experience with SharePoint sites, document libraries, and file organization best practicesFamiliarity with workflow automations and integrations (Power Automate, Zapier, Make, etc.)Experience using AI-powered productivity tools, especially for drafting, summarization, documentation, or workflow support (Microsoft Copilot experience a plus)Exposure to APIs, JavaScript, SQL, and/or Microsoft 365 ecosystem tools Preferred Candidate Profile (Ideal Fit)The ideal candidate enjoys being the bridge between business users and technical systems and can translate real-world work into clean, efficient workflows. They are comfortable speaking with others, asking clarifying questions, and building structure from ambiguity.You are likely a strong fit if you: Enjoy organizing complex information into clear systems and processesCommunicate easily and can work with a wide range of internal stakeholdersLearn new tools quickly and enjoy troubleshooting and improving workflowsThink logically about how work moves from intake → execution → approvals → completionCare about good user experience and adoption (not just building the tool)Are comfortable using AI tools appropriately to increase productivity while validating accuracy and respecting sensitive dataThis role is especially well-suited for someone who wants to develop toward a long-term career path such as:Business Systems AnalystWorkflow / CRM Systems AdministratorMonday.com System Administrator / Product OwnerBusiness Operations / Process Improvement AnalystKey Traits for SuccessStrong communicator and relationship builderCurious, self-directed, and eager to learnComfortable with ambiguity, change, and evolving prioritiesAble to balance “big picture” workflow thinking with detailed configuration workDependable and able to provide consistent full-time supportWhat You’ll GainHands-on experience supporting an enterprise workflow + CRM environment in Monday.comExposure to requirements gathering, workflow design, testing, documentation, and user adoptionPractical experience supporting SharePoint as a document repositoryModern productivity experience using Microsoft CopilotMentorship and development with potential opportunity for future full-time employment based on performance and organizational needsInterns are paid through our Managed Service Provider Program and are not employees of Eversource.  Pay rates are hourly, based on year of graduation and if the role is technical or non-technical. Rates start at $18.12 for a freshman and go up to $27.63 for a graduate level student.Worker Type:Student / Intern (Fixed Term) (Trainee)Number of Openings:1Emergency Response:Responding to emergency situations to meet customers’ needs is part of every employee’s role. If employed, you will be given an Emergency Restoration assignment.  This means you may be called to assist during an emergency outside of your normal responsibilities, work hours and location. EEO Statement:Eversource Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability status, or protected veteran status.VEVRRA Federal Contractor
